Text saved: Power distance is about the space between a boss and a worker. Sometimes this space is big. Sometimes it is small.

At her old job, Gabriela worked in a high power distance culture. In this culture, the space between a boss and a worker is very big. Leaders have a lot of power. They make the big decisions. Workers do not often question them.

But Gabriela's new team in Sweden is different. They work in a low power distance culture. Here, the space between a boss and a worker is small. Workers and bosses often work together. They find answers and make decisions together. Leaders are like coaches. They want workers to think for themselves. They also want workers to ask questions.
